main_definition: A tire, also known as a tyre in British English, is the outer part of a wheel that provides traction between the vehicle and the road surface.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To become weary or bored with something
meanings_and_examples.example: After hours of studying, I began to tire of reading the same material.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A failure to achieve a desired goal or outcome
meanings_and_examples.example: The team faced disappointment when they lost the championship game by one point.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove the tire from a vehicle, typically for maintenance or replacement purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: I had to take my car to the mechanic because it was time to replace the old tires.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A feeling of exhaustion or fatigue in oneself
meanings_and_examples.example: After running a marathon, she felt completely tired and needed to rest her body.
